intro: Hermannia micropetala, commonly known as the small-petalled hermannia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often covered in fine hairs. Hermannia micropetala thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
